page.title: 03ECOLOGY - WOODLANDS
page.content: Woodland covers about one-fifth of our Domesday area and the Guisecliffe Woods are what remains of the primeval woodland, which were mainly oakwood and were probably shown in the first Domesday Survey. Of the trees in the lower woodland about 54% are silver birch, 28% are rowan, 12% are oak and the remaining 6% are holly trees. Of the trees in the upper woodland, however, 38% were holly, 22% were silver birch, 18% were rowan, 12% were oak and the remaining trees were beech and elderberry (5% each). The trees that were found in the valley bottom were beech, sycamore, alder, hazel, horse chestnut , ash, hornbeam and willow.
